name: Italy
description: Right (destro) = dexterous, correct, 'the law'. Left (sinistro) = sinister, eerie, unlucky. 'Mancino' (left-hander) derives from 'mancus' (maimed). 'Pede manco' = to start the day badly.
source: Schiefenhövel 2013, Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences

name: France
description: Right (droit) = straight, upright, honorable, 'the law', entitled. Left (gauche) = awkward, clumsy, ponderous. 'Se lever du pied gauche' = to get up on wrong side of bed. 'Passer l'arme à gauche' = to die.

name: Spain
description: Right (derecho) = good, straight, correct, 'the law'. Left (izquierdo, from Basque) = failure. 'José es un cero a la izquierda' = José is a complete failure. But 'zurdo' (lefty) in 'no ser zurdo' = to be clever.

name: Germany
description: Right (rechts) = correct, 'the law', 'heart on right side' = good person. Left (links) = wrong, questionable, untrustworthy. 'Jemanden linken' = to deceive. 'Linkisch' = clumsy. 'Mit dem linken Bein aufstehen' = bad day/luck.

name: Russia
description: Right (praviy) = correct, good, 'the truth' (prawda), justice. Left (leviy) = untrustworthy. 'Hodit' nalevo' = to have extramarital affair. 'Levhsa' = sneaky person. Left-hander (liewshá) = untrustworthy.

name: England (UK)
description: Right = correct, 'the law', entitlement. Left (Old English 'lyft' = weak, worthless) = wrong, weak. 'Out in left field' = completely mistaken. Historical: 88 different dialect words for 'left-handed', mostly uncomplimentary. 'Cack-handed' = from excrement.

name: Czech Republic
description: Right (vpravo) = correct, 'the law', truth. 'Máš pravdu' = you are right. Left (levy) = wrong direction. 'Levák' = left-hander, untrustworthy person. 'Levota' = foul trick.

name: Basque Country
description: Right (esku on) = 'the good hand', correct. Left (ezker) = 'the crooked/lopsided hand'. 'Ezkerreko haur' = bastard. 'Ezkerreko begiz' = with hate. Spanish 'izquierda' borrowed from Basque 'ezker'!

name: Hungary
description: Right (jobb) = good, best, honorable, valid law. Left (bal) = bad luck, disaster, clumsy. 'Bal lábbal kelt fel' = to get up with left foot (bad start). 'Balszerencse' = misfortune.

name: Finland
description: Right (oikea) = direct, straight, honest, correct, entitled, 'the law'. 'Olla oikeassa' = to be right. Left (vasen) = faulty, defective, dishonest, bad.

name: Turkey
description: Right (sağ) = alive, lively, health, 'the law'. Left (sol) = (no specific negative associations recorded in source).

name: Ancient Hebrew
description: Right (yamin) = strong, dexterous, correct, south. Kabbalah: mercy, kindness, grace. Left (semol, etymology: 'wrapped', 'dark') = Kabbalah: courage, bravery, smartness. Tefilin worn on weaker (usually left) arm.

name: Arabic World
description: Right (yaman) = lucky, south, the right hand. Left (samal/simal) = unlucky, the left hand.

name: China
description: Right (右) = hierarchically higher. 'Nobody can stand more on the right' = unsurpassable. Emperor's right-side servants had higher status. At weddings, respected persons sit on right. Left (左) = sometimes 'dark side'. Cantonese associates evil with 'left'.

name: Japan
description: Right (migi) = correct. Left (hidari) = wrong, bad. 'Sasen' = sending to lower position. 'Sado' = wrong road. 'Hidari-mae' = financial troubles.

name: Korea
description: Right (oreun) = correct. Left (oen) = wrong, bad.

name: Indonesia
description: Right (kanan) = lucky, proper. 'Langkah kanan' = to walk the right way, to be lucky. Left (kiri) = clumsy, unlucky, impolite. 'Kidal' = left-handed, awkward.

name: Trobriand Islands (PNG)
description: Right (kakata) = sharp, correct. Left (kikivama) = to be wrong. 'Tokikivama' = left-hander.

name: Eipo (West Papua)
description: Right (sidik) = correct, proper. 'Saboka sidik' = proper tobacco. Left (kwanim) = 'to roll fibers on thigh' (female work), wrong.

name: Ethiopia (Amharic)
description: Right (gann) = correct, positive action, justice. 'Ha gann saw' = good person. Left (gêra) = clumsy, difficult, ungraceful, bad. 'Gêra yegebau' = confused, perplexed person.

name: Kenya (Meru)
description: Right (urio) = north, day, white clans, first wife, senior, man, superior, east, sunrise, political power, older, cultivation. Left (umotho) = south, night, black clans, co-wife, junior, woman/child, west, darkness, religious authority, younger, honey collection.

name: Tanzania (Kaguru)
description: Right (kulume) = man/masculine, eating hand, strength, upstream, stable, bones/teeth, land, white, east/south, purity, cooked, initiated. Left (kumoso) = woman/feminine, defecation hand, weak, downstream, blood, water, red, west/north, pollution, uncooked, uninitiated.

name: Chile/Argentina (Mapuche)
description: Right (man) = good, life, day, health, ancestral spirits, shaman, afterworld, abundance, east, summer, sun, yellow/white, priest, man, senior, gift-giver. Left (welel) = evil, death, night, sickness, evil spirits, sorcerer, underworld, poverty, west, winter, moon, black, woman/child, subordinate, gift-receiver, incest.

name: Sweden
description: Right (höger) = comfortable, pleasing. Left (vänster, from 'vän' = friend, helpful) = EUPHEMISM used to avoid negativity. Old High German 'winistar' = friend. No strong negative associations.

name: Norway
description: Right (høyre) = comfortable. Left (venstre) = from euphemism 'friend'. No strong negative associations in modern usage.

name: Denmark
description: Right (højre) = comfortable. Left (venstre) = neutral/euphemistic. BUT: 'kejthåndet', 'avethåndet', 'kejtet' = clumsy, awkward; 'avet' (dialect) = clumsy, wrong.

name: Ancient Greece
description: Right (δεξιός) = acceptable, sure, favorable, dexterous, handshake, promise. Left (αριστερός, from 'αριστός' = 'the best', EUPHEMISM) = bringing bad omen, clumsy, wrong. Euphemism shows awareness of stigma.

name: Romania
description: Right (dreapta) = straight, vertical, correct, just cause, justice, 'the law'. Left (stânga, from Latin 'stancus' = tired, weak) = weak, clumsy, awkwardness.

name: Uganda (Lugbara)
description: Right = male, home, earth, genealogy, daytime, light, sexual intercourse, good, moral authority. Left = female, menstrual blood, bush, sky, myth, night/darkness, sexual abstinence, evil, amoral, chaos, power.

name: Namibia (Himba)
description: Right (ko-koma-nene) = high/high-ranked, old/older, elder, leaders, to fit, to suffice. Left (-muho-) = (no specific negative meaning recorded).
